item.title: Azure Resource Manager - Defining resource dependencies in ARM templates
item.description: So far in this series, you have learned how to implement basic ARM templates by provisioning storage accounts and virtual networks, made these templates reusable by adding parameters, variables, and expressions, and learned how to reduce complexity of ARM templates using reusable custom user-defined functions. In the last part, you looked at how to secure secrets in an ARM template by provisioning Azure Key Vault and adding & retrieving secrets from the vault. This also completed close to 40% of the template definition for the infrastructure shown in the above diagram. What you have learned so far can be considered as the basics of ARM template development. From today’s part onwards, you will get introduced to advanced techniques in ARM template authoring. First, take a look at creating resource dependencies in ARM templates.
